title: What inspired the creation of something so insanely spicy? Here's how Buldak came to be
subtitle: #K-food #Buldak
introduction: Today I'm going to talk about the origin story of Buldak.

paragraphs: The name Buldak combines fire and chicken in Korean. Interestingly, the chicken in the name connects to how the product was born.
Back in spring 2010, Kim Jung-soo, Vice Chairwoman of Samyang Foods, was grabbing lunch at this restaurant that served crazy spicy chicken on a sizzling hot plate.

At that moment, she noticed people literally sweating, fanning their mouths, stuck somewhere between this is amazing and why am I doing this to myself? Watching them, she started thinking they could bottle this kind of spiciness in instant ramen.

After that, the team set out to discover the ideal spice level for Korean consumers. They worked with peppers from different countries, such as Cheongyang, habanero, Vietnamese, Tabasco, and Bhut Jolokia, testing different mixes to nail down the best sauce balance. Through trial and error, they finally released Buldak in 2012.

The launch wasn't smooth sailing, though. Early reviews claimed it was too spicy, essentially inedible. Yet it found its audience among spice enthusiasts, and word-of-mouth quickly spread. Sales began to climb.
Now, however, Buldak Ramen has exploded in popularity with Gen Alpha across the globe, fueled by the spicy food craze and viral content from social media influencers.

paragraphs.heading: Fun fact about the Buldak creator, Kim Jung-soo
paragraphs: When Samyang Foods went bankrupt during the 1997 financial crisis, Kim Jung-soo joined the company the following year at her father-in-law's suggestion.

paragraphs.heading: How to Enjoy Buldak
paragraphs: If you haven't tried it yet, give it a shot. It's one of the best ways to dive into K-food culture.

For spice-sensitive eaters: I recommend using half the sauce packet or even less. Even as a Korean, I can't handle much heat and stick to half the sauce myself. Since Buldak comes in several varieties with different spice levels, check out Reddit's spice tier rankings to find your ideal match.
Pro tip: Adding cheese to the original or Carbonara versions takes the flavor to another level. The richness balances the heat perfectly.
Want more ideas? Search how to make Buldak taste better on YouTube for tons of creative recipe variations.

paragraphs.heading: Why global fans love Buldak
paragraphs: Based on comments from Reddit communities, global fans praise two things: the addictive spiciness that keeps them coming back for more, and the high-quality noodles themselves. Many specifically praise the thick, chewy texture that sets Buldak apart from other instant ramen.
